title: 190lb mastiff is so big firefighters had to rescue him after he got hurt on walk
text:
Floyd the 190-pound mastiff is so big and heavy his owner had to cal 911 for help after he suffered a minor injury while out walking on a remote hiking trail (Pictures: Salt Lake City Sheriff’s Search and Rescue)

A 190-pound mastiff’s huge size meant firefighters had to rescue him on a stretcher after he suffered a minor injury during a walk.

The dog, named Floyd, got hurt two miles up the Grandeur Peak Trail in Millcreek Canyon, Utah, on Sunday night.

Floyd’s considerable bulk meant there was no way for his owner to carry him back down to safety, so they called 911.

Rescuers from Salt Lake County Sheriff’s Search and Rescue (SLCOSAR) arrived on the scene shortly after, and loaded the three year-old pet onto a special wheeled stretcher known as a litter.

He was then carried back down to safety by four burly volunteers – and behaved impeccably throughout the four hour operation.

Floyd was loaded onto a special wheeled stretcher called a litter (Picture: Salt Lake City Sheriff’s Search and Rescue)

The well-behaved dog was then wheeled down the mountain, and finally made it to safety four hours later (Picture: Salt Lake City Sheriff’s Search and Rescue)

Floyd is now recovering after his ordeal, but should be back out hiking again soon (Picture: Salt Lake City Sheriff’s Search and Rescue)

A rescue spokesman said: ‘SLCOSAR got a call for a 190-pound, 3-year-old Male injured Mastiff about two miles up the Grandeur Peak Trail.

‘Several hikers had called Unified Police to report that the dog and his owner were on the trail and not able to move.

‘Salt Lake County Search and Rescue members went into action and headed up the trail to make sure Floyd could get off the mountain with his human before it got too cold.

‘Floyd was packaged in a litter and carried down the mountain.

‘Floyd was a good boy and was happy to be assisted. Floyd his human and all the team members got off the mountain around 10:30PM.

‘Hopefully, Floyd will be up and hiking again soon!’
description: Floyd the dog's owner had to call in specialist help after the much-loved pet was injured in Salt Lake County, Utah
